title: Valentino, Fashion Designer to the Jet Set, Dies at 93 in Rome
summary: The iconic Italian designer was adored by generations of royals, first ladies and movie stars.
body: Valentino Garavani, the jet-set Italian designer whose high-glamour gowns — often in his trademark shade of “Valentino red” — were fashion show staples for nearly half a century, has died at home in Rome, his foundation announced Monday (Jan. 19). He was 93. “Valentino Garavani was not only a constant guide and inspiration for all of us, but a true source of light, creativity and vision,” the foundation said in a statement posted on social media. Related Gone But Not Forgotten: Musicians We Lost in 2025 Artists in Armani: A Look Back at the Late Designer’s Best Looks for Music Stars Arthur McGee, Fashion Designer Who Dressed Stevie Wonder and Lena Horne, Dies at 86 His body will repose at the foundation’s headquarters in Rome on Wednesday and Thursday. The funeral will be held Friday at the Basilica Santa Maria degli Angeli e dei Martiri in Rome’s Piazza della Repubblica. Universally known by his first name, Valentino was adored by generations of royals, first ladies and movie stars, from Jackie Kennedy Onassis to Julia Roberts and Queen Rania of Jordan, who swore the designer always made them look and feel their best. “I know what women want,” he once r…
